original: byin pa'i rtsa ba rab tu bsten //
analyzed: byin pa'i rtsa ba rab tu bsten //
translated: The king, hearing this, said: Let him be protected by the root of my charity.

original: rab skrag mig ni 'khrul byed cing //
analyzed: rab skrag mig ni 'khrul byed cing //
translated: And he, seeing him trembling, with rolling eyes,

original: yan lag kun tu 'khums pa de //🔽mthong nas sa yi bdag po ni //
analyzed: yan lag kun tu 'khums pa de // mthong nas sa yi bdag po ni //
translated: and all his limbs contracted,

original: 'phral la brtse ba'i dbang du gyur //
analyzed: 'phral la brtse ba'i dbang du gyur //
translated: was immediately overcome by pity.

original: 'di yi 'jigs pa gang las shes //
analyzed: 'di yi 'jigs pa gang las shes //
translated: And he said: What is the cause of his fear?

original: rab @38a * //🔽li n'i ai b'a ga ti: //
analyzed: rab @38a * // li n'i ai b'a ga ti: //
translated: And the bird, with a human voice, said:🔽I have no fear from anywhere else, but from the crow,🔽who is a thief and a robber, and is always looking out for an opportunity.

original: ku to sya bha ya mi tya sh'a dr'i sh'i kshi pram bya lo ka yata //🔽tasminna ba sa re satva dzi dzny'a su p'a ka sh'a sa na: //
analyzed: ku to sya bha ya mi tya sh'a dr'i sh'i kshi pram bya lo ka yata // tasminna ba sa re satva dzi dzny'a su p'a ka sh'a sa na: //
translated: And he, O King, is my enemy, and is always seeking to kill me.🔽 The king, hearing this, said: Let him be protected by my power.🔽 And the bird, with a human voice, said: O King, I am not afraid of the crow,🔽but of the owl, who is a thief and a robber, and is always looking out for an opportunity.

original: ma ya y'a lubdha k'a k'a ra:sa ma bhye dya bra t'i nri pam //
analyzed: ma ya y'a lubdha k'a k'a ra:sa ma bhye dya bra t'i nri pam //
translated: And he, O King, is my enemy, and is always seeking to kill me.

original: de ba * //
analyzed: de ba * //
translated: The king, hearing this, said: Let him be protected by my power.🔽 And the bird, with a human voice, said: O King, I am not afraid of the owl,

original: rgyas padma'i 'phreng ldan gyis //
analyzed: rgyas padma'i 'phreng ldan gyis //
translated: but of the falcon, who is a thief and a robber, and is always looking out for an opportunity.🔽 And he, O King, is my enemy, and is always seeking to kill me.🔽 The king, hearing this, said: Let him be protected by my power.🔽 And the bird, with a human voice, said: O King, I am not afraid of the falcon,

original: padmo can ltar 'od gsal ba'i //
analyzed: padmo can ltar 'od gsal ba'i //
translated: but of the cat, who is a thief and a robber, and is always looking out for an opportunity.🔽 And he, O King, is my enemy, and is always seeking to kill me.

original: spyan gyis myur du phyogs rnams bltas //
analyzed: spyan gyis myur du phyogs rnams bltas //
translated: The king, hearing this, said: Let him be protected by my power.🔽 And the bird, with a human voice, said: O King, I am not afraid of the cat,🔽but of the mongoose

original: skabs der smin pa gsod byed ni //
analyzed: skabs der smin pa gsod byed ni //
translated: At that time, the one who killed the ripe fruit

original: snying stobs brtag par 'dod pa yi //
analyzed: snying stobs brtag par 'dod pa yi //
translated: Desiring to test his courage,

original: sgyu mas rngon pa'i rnam par ni //
analyzed: sgyu mas rngon pa'i rnam par ni //
translated: In the form of a hunter,

original: 'ongs nas mi bdag la smras pa //
analyzed: 'ongs nas mi bdag la smras pa //
translated: Approached and said to the king:

original: lha gcig munytsa bi ts'a tr'aptam bha kshyam ma ma bi ham ga mam //🔽ai yam na:sa ha dz'a britti ra na britta ra y'a tsa n'a //🔽ni sarga siddha me tadme bho dza nam dza ga t'i pa te //
analyzed: lha gcig munytsa bi ts'a tr'aptam bha kshyam ma ma bi ham ga mam // ai yam na:sa ha dz'a britti ra na britta ra y'a tsa n'a // ni sarga siddha me tadme bho dza nam dza ga t'i pa te //
translated: Your Majesty, release the peacock, my food, my guest.🔽This is my natural livelihood,

original: tya dza to dz'i bi tam nasti pra n'a hya sha na dh'a ra n'a: //
analyzed: tya dza to dz'i bi tam nasti pra n'a hya sha na dh'a ra n'a: //
translated: My food, established by nature,🔽Given by the Creator himself.🔽If I give up this life,🔽I will be blamed by the people.🔽In a moment, I will kill the peacock,

original: ksha ne yun ring na rnyed pa'i //🔽bdag gi bza' ba bya de thong //
analyzed: ksha ne yun ring na rnyed pa'i // bdag gi bza' ba bya de thong //
translated: Hard to obtain in a long time,

original: 'di ni ma bslangs mi zlog pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ni ma bslangs mi zlog pa'i //
translated: My food, not begged or refused,

original: bdag cag lhan skyes 'tsho ba yin //
analyzed: bdag cag lhan skyes 'tsho ba yin //
translated: My natural livelihood.

original: 'gro ba'i bdag po bdag gi zas //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bdag po bdag gi zas //
translated: The lord of the world, my food,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni grub pa 'di //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni grub pa 'di //
translated: Established by nature,

original: med na 'cho ba gtong par 'gyur //
analyzed: med na 'cho ba gtong par 'gyur //
translated: If not given, I will give up my life,

original: gang phyer zas ni srog gi zungs //
analyzed: gang phyer zas ni srog gi zungs //
translated: Since food is the support of life.

original: dus 'dir tasminna shatstshe d'anma yi sa tyakt'a dz'i bi te //
analyzed: dus 'dir tasminna shatstshe d'anma yi sa tyakt'a dz'i bi te //
translated: At this time, the king's life was cut off by the truth of the ascetics.🔽His wife, with her hopes cut off, her eyes filled with tears,

original: bi natksh'a ti bi lubt'a sh'a sa pu t'a me ku drum bi n'i //🔽aa ka sam ksha ne nee ba ya: ka ro ti ba hu raksha yam //
analyzed: bi natksh'a ti bi lubt'a sh'a sa pu t'a me ku drum bi n'i // aa ka sam ksha ne nee ba ya: ka ro ti ba hu raksha yam //
translated: in a moment, as if in a dream, did many things.

original: sa dharmmo ya tra dharm'atta ta dharma stam tra k'i tri sha: //🔽ma zas ni chad pa las //
analyzed: sa dharmmo ya tra dharm'atta ta dharma stam tra k'i tri sha: // ma zas ni chad pa las //
translated: Where the Dharma is, there is Dharma; where the Dharma is not, there is strife.🔽When the king's food was cut off,

original: bdag gi 'tsho ba btang gyur na //
analyzed: bdag gi 'tsho ba btang gyur na //
translated: my livelihood was lost.

original: bdag gi khyim thab bu dang bcas //
analyzed: bdag gi khyim thab bu dang bcas //
translated: My husband and children,

original: re ba chad pas rnams nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: re ba chad pas rnams nyams 'gyur //
translated: their hopes cut off, are ruined.

original: chos ldan gang gis gcig nyid ni //
analyzed: chos ldan gang gis gcig nyid ni //
translated: What is the Dharma, by which

original: bsrungs pas gang du mang po dag / chos las nyams par gyur na bye //
analyzed: bsrungs pas gang du mang po dag / chos las nyams par gyur na bye //
translated: one is protected, and many are not lost to the Dharma?

original: de la chos ni ci zhig 'dra //🔽phug @38b yi p'a r'a ba ty'apr'i ty'a na dve sha kartu marha si //
analyzed: de la chos ni ci zhig 'dra // phug @38b yi p'a r'a ba ty'apr'i ty'a na dve sha kartu marha si //

original: na hi k'a ra na r'a ge na pra barttante bha badve dh'a: //🔽ya thee b'a yam ta thee b'a ham ko bi she kha sta b'a ba yoo: //
analyzed: na hi k'a ra na r'a ge na pra barttante bha badve dh'a: //🔽ya thee b'a yam ta thee b'a ham ko bi she kha sta b'a ba yoo: //
translated: In the absence of anger, hatred does not arise.🔽In the absence of desire, passion does not arise.🔽In the absence of pride, conceit does not arise.

original: sarba bh'u ta sa ma:santa:kri s'annee ka tra kurbba te //
analyzed: sarba bh'u ta sa ma:santa:kri s'annee ka tra kurbba te //
translated: Sarva-bhūta-samaṃ santaḥ kriyatām eka-traya-kṛtāḥ.

original: ai tyukte te ron la ni byams pa yis //🔽bdag la zhe sdang bya mi 'os //
analyzed: ai tyukte te ron la ni byams pa yis // bdag la zhe sdang bya mi 'os //

original: gang phyir khyod nyid lta bu ni //🔽sgyu ldan chags pas 'jug pa min //
analyzed: gang phyir khyod nyid lta bu ni // sgyu ldan chags pas 'jug pa min //
translated: Na tvayā dveṣṭi yo 'tmānaṃ tasmai tvam iva me 'priyaḥ.🔽 Yasmāt tvadvad ahaṃ na anyaṃ kāmayeyaṃ na rakṣaye.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid de bzhin bdag / khyed la nged gnyis bye brag ci //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid de bzhin bdag / khyed la nged gnyis bye brag ci //

original: dam pa 'byung po kun la snyoms //
analyzed: dam pa 'byung po kun la snyoms //
translated: Sadbhir bhūteṣu sarveṣu samaṃ yo 'nukaṃpāyate.

original: gcig la brtse ba byed pa min //
analyzed: gcig la brtse ba byed pa min //
translated: Na ekasminn eva bhaktyā.

original: des 'di smras tshe mi na nri pa tirl'i nam ka ka na r'a b'i n'a //
analyzed: des 'di smras tshe mi na nri pa tirl'i nam ka ka na r'a b'i n'a //
translated: Iti ukte tena nṛ-pater līlā-nakra-ravīṇā.

original: ne bha ta bya mi t'i b'a ha kha gam pratstsha dya p'a ni n'a //
analyzed: ne bha ta bya mi t'i b'a ha kha gam pratstsha dya p'a ni n'a //
translated: Neva bhāty āmīlatībhir vāha-kham pracṣadyā-pāṇibhiḥ.

original: sa ta ta:snigdha dz'i m'u ta gho sha gambh'i ra ya mi ba //
analyzed: sa ta ta:snigdha dz'i m'u ta gho sha gambh'i ra ya mi ba //
translated: Satataḥ snigdha-jīmūta-ghoṣa-gambhīraya-mīlitaiḥ.

analyzed: au b'a tsa sarbbastv'artti pa ri tr'a na kri ta ksha na: //
translated: Uvāca sarva-sattvārti-paritrāṇa-kṛtā kṣaṇaiḥ.

original: ma kri bdag gi / lag pa gdub bu'i sgra ldan pas //🔽'jigs par mi bya zhes smra bzhin //🔽bya ni phyag gis rab bsgribs te //
analyzed: ma kri bdag gi / lag pa gdub bu'i sgra ldan pas //🔽'jigs par mi bya zhes smra bzhin //🔽bya ni phyag gis rab bsgribs te //
translated: Makaradhvaja-hastābja-svanena śravaṇābhayā.

original: de nas sems can gzir ba kun //
analyzed: de nas sems can gzir ba kun //
translated: Then, for the sake of all beings who are tormented,

original: yongs bskyab dus ni byas pa yi //🔽char sprin 'jam pa'i sgra dbyangs ltar //
analyzed: yongs bskyab dus ni byas pa yi // char sprin 'jam pa'i sgra dbyangs ltar //
translated: he, the protector, made the time🔽to speak with profound words,

analyzed: zab pa'i tshig gis rab smras pa // skad tha:ksha na tri styarth'i bi sha mam pr'a ni bee sha ma // tu mya bya th'a bi k'a ro yam pr'a na sne ha:sha r'i ri n'am // pa ra sr'a n'a pa ha re na y'a britti:pa ri kalpya te // ni britti: shre ya s'am ma hi p'a pa t'a pam pra cig tshim pa don gnyer bas // mi bzad srog chags gsod ma byed //
translated: like the sweet sound of a rain cloud.

original: lus can srog la chags pa yi //
analyzed: lus can srog la chags pa yi //
translated: Do not kill, do not steal, do not engage in sexual misconduct,🔽do not speak falsely, do not drink alcohol,🔽do not speak harshly, do not speak divisively,🔽do not speak meaninglessly,🔽do not covet, do not have malice,🔽do not hold wrong views.

original: gdung ba'i rnam 'gyur mtshungs pa nyid //🔽gzhan gyi srog ni phrogs pa yis //
analyzed: gdung ba'i rnam 'gyur mtshungs pa nyid // gzhan gyi srog ni phrogs pa yis //
translated: These are the ten virtues.🔽 He spoke these words, which are the essence of the Dharma,

original: gang zhig yongs su 'tsho byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su 'tsho byed pa //
translated: to the people who were tormented by suffering.🔽 The people, having heard the Dharma,

original: de yi dge legs ldog 'gyur te //
analyzed: de yi dge legs ldog 'gyur te //
translated: were satisfied and their suffering was pacified.🔽 They said, We are satisfied,

original: gang phyir sdig pa'i @39a * //
analyzed: gang phyir sdig pa'i @39a * //
translated: but we do not know how to practice the Dharma.🔽 Please teach us the practice of the Dharma.🔽 The king said, Very well, listen!🔽 I will teach you the practice of the Dharma.

original: yatstsha te // aa dhu nee w'a pa ritstshinne ni dzetstsha samma t'a da ram //
analyzed: yatstsha te // aa dhu nee w'a pa ritstshinne ni dzetstsha samma t'a da ram //
translated: And said: Give me a place to stay,

analyzed: gri hya t'a ma sha nam yadyanma dartha mu pa kalpi tam // shru tve ti r'a dza ba tsa nam pa ri mla n'a na n'a: shva pa na //
translated: And I will give you a son.🔽 The king, hearing this, said: I will give you🔽 Whatever food you desire.

original: ba ro pa dho ga bi * //🔽gdung ba ster //
analyzed: ba ro pa dho ga bi * // gdung ba ster //
translated: The greedy one, turning away,

original: da lta nyid du ma chad par //
analyzed: da lta nyid du ma chad par //
translated: said: I do not want the king's food,

original: rang 'dod yang dag bzhed cing gus //🔽bdag gi don du zas gang gang //
analyzed: rang 'dod yang dag bzhed cing gus // bdag gi don du zas gang gang //
translated: Which is enjoyed by the king's men.🔽 But I will take a son,

original: nye bar bsgrubs pa blang bar mdzod //🔽ces pa rgyal po'i tshig thos nas //🔽yongs su bzhin log shugs rings can //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs pa blang bar mdzod // ces pa rgyal po'i tshig thos nas // yongs su bzhin log shugs rings can //
translated: Who will be born from my body.🔽 The king, thinking: This is a great wonder,

original: longs spyod mchog la ma n'a:pra tya bh'a sha ta lubdha ka: //🔽na pa yam r'a dza bho g'a n'am ra s'a dzny'a ba na b'a si na: //🔽na hi sha sy'a sha na n'amb'a s'a mo dante mo da kee mri g'a: //
analyzed: longs spyod mchog la ma n'a:pra tya bh'a sha ta lubdha ka: //🔽na pa yam r'a dza bho g'a n'am ra s'a dzny'a ba na b'a si na: //🔽na hi sha sy'a sha na n'amb'a s'a mo dante mo da kee mri g'a: //
translated: Said to him: Take my son.

original: aa labdh'a nishla tram ma ru pa ri tsi t'am kanta ka la t'am ba yid byung ba'i //🔽rngon pas lan ni rab smras pa //
analyzed: aa labdh'a nishla tram ma ru pa ri tsi t'am kanta ka la t'am ba yid byung ba'i // rngon pas lan ni rab smras pa //
translated: The deer said, O hunter, you are a man, and I am a deer. How can we be friends?

original: bdag cag nags na gnas rnams kyis //
analyzed: bdag cag nags na gnas rnams kyis //
translated: The hunter replied, I am a hunter, and you are a deer. How can we be enemies?

original: rgyal po'i longs spyod ro mi shes //
analyzed: rgyal po'i longs spyod ro mi shes //
translated: We forest-dwellers do not know the taste of royal enjoyments.

original: 'bru zas nyams su ma myong ba'i //
analyzed: 'bru zas nyams su ma myong ba'i //
translated: We do not enjoy grain food.

original: ri dags la dus dga' ma yin //
analyzed: ri dags la dus dga' ma yin //
translated: We do not delight in deer.

original: tsher ma'i 'khri shing 'dab med mya ngan dag la yongs 'dris ma thob nas //🔽ne snigdha shy'a me ki ma pi ka ra bha:shu shya ti shu ts'a //
analyzed: tsher ma'i 'khri shing 'dab med mya ngan dag la yongs 'dris ma thob nas // ne snigdha shy'a me ki ma pi ka ra bha:shu shya ti shu ts'a //
translated: Having not attained intimacy with the thorn-entangled, leafless, and miserable,🔽the elephant, though of a different nature, is emaciated by grief for the deer.

original: na k'a ka:satp'a kam ka ba la ya ti ts'u tam bi sha mi ba sva bh'a b'a n'am bhe d'a du tsi ta mi ha sarbba sya su kha dam //
analyzed: na k'a ka:satp'a kam ka ba la ya ti ts'u tam bi sha mi ba sva bh'a b'a n'am bhe d'a du tsi ta mi ha sarbba sya su kha dam //
translated: The crow, though of a different nature, is not satisfied by eating the flesh of the partridge.

original: r'a dz'arha bho gam bhug+dva dya pr'a tarbhoktv'a smi kim pu na: //
analyzed: r'a dz'arha bho gam bhug+dva dya pr'a tarbhoktv'a smi kim pu na: //
translated: The king, though deserving of enjoyments, is distressed by the loss of his beloved.

original: tadbhaktam nags tshal ljang zhing snum par rnga mo mya ngan dag gis ci yang skam //
analyzed: tadbhaktam nags tshal ljang zhing snum par rnga mo mya ngan dag gis ci yang skam //
translated: That beloved, though green and oily in the forest, is dried up by the grief of the elephant.

original: ts'u ta rab smin dug bzhin bya rog gis ni za bar mi byed de //
analyzed: ts'u ta rab smin dug bzhin bya rog gis ni za bar mi byed de //
translated: The ripe fruit of the cuta tree is not eaten by crows, as if it were poison.

original: rang bzhin dag gi dbye bas 'os pa 'dir ni kun la bde ba ster //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag gi dbye bas 'os pa 'dir ni kun la bde ba ster //
translated: But here, by the division of their natures, it gives pleasure to all.

original: rgyal la 'os zas ding zos nas //🔽nang bar slar yang bdag ci za //
analyzed: rgyal la 'os zas ding zos nas // nang bar slar yang bdag ci za //
translated: Having eaten the food suitable for a king,🔽what shall I eat in the morning?

original: gang zhig nyin @39b su kha m'a dhante ya da n+ya dyu na durla bham //
analyzed: gang zhig nyin @39b su kha m'a dhante ya da n+ya dyu na durla bham //
translated: That which is not difficult to obtain for others during the day,🔽having been thoroughly enjoyed by the swans,🔽the water remaining in the lakes, though devoid of beauty,

original: ra so d'a r'a ha re na hi pa ri tsi tashn'a ti bi ra sanna tishtha tye k'a k'i ba hu pa ri dza n'a ram bha pa ti tam //🔽ra th'a ru dha: padbhya ma ma na sa ma ye sho tsa ti ta r'a ma b'apt'artha bhram sha: gzhan rnyed dka' min //
analyzed: ra so d'a r'a ha re na hi pa ri tsi tashn'a ti bi ra sanna tishtha tye k'a k'i ba hu pa ri dza n'a ram bha pa ti tam // ra th'a ru dha: padbhya ma ma na sa ma ye sho tsa ti ta r'a ma b'apt'artha bhram sha: gzhan rnyed dka' min //
translated: is drunk by the crows, the lowest of birds.

original: de dag zos na bde ba skyed //
analyzed: de dag zos na bde ba skyed //
translated: Having eaten that, they experience pleasure.

original: rgya che ro ldan kha zas yongs 'dris ro dang bral ba zad mi byed //
analyzed: rgya che ro ldan kha zas yongs 'dris ro dang bral ba zad mi byed //
translated: One should not destroy the food that is abundant and tasty, though it be of inferior taste.

original: 'khor gyi rtsom pa mang por lhung rnams gcig pu nyid du gnas mi byed //
analyzed: 'khor gyi rtsom pa mang por lhung rnams gcig pu nyid du gnas mi byed //
translated: One should not remain alone, having fallen into the many beginnings of a crowd.

original: shing rta zhon pa rkang pas 'gro ba'i dus na shin tu mya ngan byed //
analyzed: shing rta zhon pa rkang pas 'gro ba'i dus na shin tu mya ngan byed //
translated: When the chariot is mounted, one grieves for the time of walking on foot.

original: don thob nyams na mi bzad ka sha ti bi sha ma kle sha pa ru sha: //🔽de ba tvaddrisht'a drisht'a n'am sa ta tam nee ba durlla bham //🔽r'a dz'arha bho dza nam kim tu dzanma p'urbbam na me pri yam //🔽mri ga y'a bhi ha tam m'ans'a masm'a kam dz'i bi t'a ya te //🔽nyon mongs rtsub mor shin tu gdung bar byed //
analyzed: don thob nyams na mi bzad ka sha ti bi sha ma kle sha pa ru sha: // de ba tvaddrisht'a drisht'a n'am sa ta tam nee ba durlla bham // r'a dz'arha bho dza nam kim tu dzanma p'urbbam na me pri yam // mri ga y'a bhi ha tam m'ans'a masm'a kam dz'i bi t'a ya te // nyon mongs rtsub mor shin tu gdung bar byed //
translated: When the attainment of the goal is lost, there is the unbearable torment of the kashta and vishama kleśa.🔽The food fit for a king, which is always easily obtained

original: lha gcig rgyal po la 'os zas //
analyzed: lha gcig rgyal po la 'os zas //
translated: by the eyes of the gods, is not at all dear to me in this birth.🔽The flesh of deer killed by hunters is enjoyed by us as if it were our own life.🔽That which is produced from the blood of deer,🔽which is mixed with the fat of pigs,

original: khyod kyi spyan kyis gzigs rnams la //
analyzed: khyod kyi spyan kyis gzigs rnams la //

translated: He is surrounded by the sages, and is protected by the power of truth.🔽 The king, his mind agitated by the poison of passion, said: Go and bring him here.🔽 The minister, his face pale, his body trembling, said: The prince is in the forest, in the hermitage of the sage.

original: n'a y'a ti b'agbhi:pra sha mam bi sh'a la dzva l'a ka l'a pa pra ba la:sma r'agni: //🔽de shes skha lannisdzha r'a sh'i ta lo pa shugs rings ngal zhing 'khrul bar rjod byed pas //
analyzed: n'a y'a ti b'agbhi:pra sha mam bi sh'a la dzva l'a ka l'a pa pra ba la:sma r'agni: // de shes skha lannisdzha r'a sh'i ta lo pa shugs rings ngal zhing 'khrul bar rjod byed pas //
translated: I am not able to bear the burden of the body.

original: 'brel med don gyi cho nge de de smras //🔽rnal gnas nyer bstan khyod kyis byed pa 'di //
analyzed: 'brel med don gyi cho nge de de smras // rnal gnas nyer bstan khyod kyis byed pa 'di //
translated: The king, hearing this, said to him:

original: 'dod pas gzir ba bdag gis 'ga' mi thos //
analyzed: 'dod pas gzir ba bdag gis 'ga' mi thos //
translated: I have never heard of such a meaningless lamentation from one like you, who are well-composed and well-instructed.

original: lhag par rab 'bar 'dod pa'i me yi tshogs //
analyzed: lhag par rab 'bar 'dod pa'i me yi tshogs //
translated: The fire of passion, which is burning more and more,

original: rgyas pa tshig gis rab tu zhi mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyas pa tshig gis rab tu zhi mi 'gyur //
translated: cannot be extinguished by words, however extensive.

original: yul na bsil ba'i chu rgyun 'brub mod kyang //🔽bha banti tapt'a ni ma ru stha l'a ni //
analyzed: yul na bsil ba'i chu rgyun 'brub mod kyang // bha banti tapt'a ni ma ru stha l'a ni //
translated: Even if cool streams of water were to flow in the realm,🔽they would not extinguish the burning of the passionate.

original: r'a g'a tu r'a n'a mu da ye si bh'a norgho r'andha k'a r'a ni di ganta r'a ni //
analyzed: r'a g'a tu r'a n'a mu da ye si bh'a norgho r'andha k'a r'a ni di ganta r'a ni //
translated: The passionate, who are blinded by the terrible darkness of passion,🔽do not have the power to see the path of liberation.

original: n'a stya ba tapt'a ma ba l'am da y'a lo:sam raksha ta ste ya di ko bi dharmma: //
analyzed: n'a stya ba tapt'a ma ba l'am da y'a lo:sam raksha ta ste ya di ko bi dharmma: //
translated: If the world were without the burning of passion,🔽it would be protected, if it were to follow the true Dharma.

original: tat+s'a dhu bhirdarshi ta goo ra ba sya tasya yya bha be ka tha mastya dharmma: //
analyzed: tat+s'a dhu bhirdarshi ta goo ra ba sya tasya yya bha be ka tha mastya dharmma: //
translated: The Dharma of the good is not for those who are not compassionate.

original: ye mya ngam thang rnams dag ni gdung bar 'gyur //🔽nyi ma shar yang chags pas gzir rnams la //
analyzed: ye mya ngam thang rnams dag ni gdung bar 'gyur // nyi ma shar yang chags pas gzir rnams la //
translated: The deserts are tormented by the heat,🔽and the directions, though the sun has risen, are terrifying with darkness

original: phyogs mtshams rnams ni 'jigs rung mun pa yin //🔽gdung ba'i bud med bsrungs la chos ci yang //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams rnams ni 'jigs rung mun pa yin // gdung ba'i bud med bsrungs la chos ci yang //
translated: for those oppressed by passion.

original: gal te brtse ldan khyod la med na ni //
analyzed: gal te brtse ldan khyod la med na ni //
translated: If you, O compassionate one, do not have it,🔽then how can there be any Dharma for a woman tormented by passion?

original: dam pa rnams kyis gus par bstan pa de //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis gus par bstan pa de //
translated: That which the good teach with respect,

original: med pa la yang chos min ji ltar yod //
analyzed: med pa la yang chos min ji ltar yod //
translated: how can it exist for one who does not have it?🔽The trees, though firm in their own place,

original: gang shr'i ta la:sva stha dhi ya:su kh'a ya te sh'am pra m'a nam sthi ra ae sha dharmma: //
analyzed: gang shr'i ta la:sva stha dhi ya:su kh'a ya te sh'am pra m'a nam sthi ra ae sha dharmma: //
translated: are shaken by the wind, and their shade is unstable.

original: sant'a pi t'a n'am bya sa n'a tu r'a n'am ni shiddha k'ar++ye shva bi ko bi ts'a ra: //
analyzed: sant'a pi t'a n'am bya sa n'a tu r'a n'am ni shiddha k'ar++ye shva bi ko bi ts'a ra: //
translated: The duties of the householders, though well-established,🔽are destroyed by the wandering of the mind.

original: ma mee ba p'a pam pra tha ma gri h'i tam dharmmo sti te matpa ri raksha ne na //
analyzed: ma mee ba p'a pam pra tha ma gri h'i tam dharmmo sti te matpa ri raksha ne na //
translated: I do not see any other protection for the mind🔽than the Dharma, which is well-established in the house.

original: sparshe na nirbb'a pa ya santa t'amme sant'a pa t'am blo rnal gnas bsil ba de dag la //
analyzed: sparshe na nirbb'a pa ya santa t'amme sant'a pa t'am blo rnal gnas bsil ba de dag la //
translated: But to those whose minds are cool with the calm of Nirvana,

original: bde slad brtan pa chos 'di tshad ma ste //
analyzed: bde slad brtan pa chos 'di tshad ma ste //
translated: This doctrine is a standard of happiness.

original: zhen pas gzir cing yang dag gdungs rnams la //
analyzed: zhen pas gzir cing yang dag gdungs rnams la //
translated: To those who are tormented by the fever of desire,

original: bkag pa'i bya ba la yang spyod pa ci //
analyzed: bkag pa'i bya ba la yang spyod pa ci //
translated: What is the use of prohibitions?

original: nga nyid kyis ni sdig pa dang por blangs //
analyzed: nga nyid kyis ni sdig pa dang por blangs //
translated: I myself first took up sin,

original: bdag yongs bsrungs bas khyod la chos su 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag yongs bsrungs bas khyod la chos su 'gyur //
translated: But by guarding myself, I have become virtuous for you.

original: rig pa ri bong can ltar bsil ba yis //🔽rgyun du gdung @55a * //
analyzed: rig pa ri bong can ltar bsil ba yis // rgyun du gdung @55a * //
translated: By the cool knowledge of the moon,

original: ti sha sha sh'i ta le na //
analyzed: ti sha sha sh'i ta le na //
translated: I constantly burn away the fever of the world.

original: sant'a pam ha ra to bi dho: ksha ya ya hast'i bram ta mo bh'a sva ta:shr'i ta kle sha ma harni sham sha ma ya ta:p'a pam ki marme:pha lam //
analyzed: sant'a pam ha ra to bi dho: ksha ya ya hast'i bram ta mo bh'a sva ta:shr'i ta kle sha ma harni sham sha ma ya ta:p'a pam ki marme:pha lam //
translated: I destroy the darkness of ignorance, I remove the great fear of passion, I destroy sin, I am the refuge of the world.

original: kr'a hi dzny'a dza sa masta sh'astra ya d'i pa sa tyam tva me bhaspu tam trishta:kam bya sa n'a tu raksha na sa * //🔽bas nyen bdag bde bar mdzod //
analyzed: kr'a hi dzny'a dza sa masta sh'astra ya d'i pa sa tyam tva me bhaspu tam trishta:kam bya sa n'a tu raksha na sa * //🔽bas nyen bdag bde bar mdzod //
translated: I am the friend of the poor, I am the preceptor of the world, I am the truth of the truthful, I am the austerity of the austere, I am the sacrifice of the sacrificers.

original: gdung ba 'phrog byed zla ba dang ni mi bzad mun pa nyams byed nyi ma dang // nyin dang mtshan mar grang ba'i nyon mongs zhi byed me la sdig pa'i 'bras bu ci //
analyzed: gdung ba 'phrog byed zla ba dang ni mi bzad mun pa nyams byed nyi ma dang // nyin dang mtshan mar grang ba'i nyon mongs zhi byed me la sdig pa'i 'bras bu ci //
translated: What sin is there in the moon, which dispels the heat, or in the sun, which destroys the thick darkness, or in fire, which allays the cold of night and day?

original: gdung bas gzing ba bsrung ba dang mnyam las bzang chos ni gang du ci zhig mthong //
analyzed: gdung bas gzing ba bsrung ba dang mnyam las bzang chos ni gang du ci zhig mthong //
translated: What good law do you see anywhere, which is not violated by the heat of passion?

original: bstan bcos mtha' ma: satkarmma dharmma:kva tsi ta //🔽ra ha sya bhee de tra na kashtsi dasti dza nodzdzhi ta:sam pri ta ae sha de sha: //
analyzed: bstan bcos mtha' ma: satkarmma dharmma:kva tsi ta // ra ha sya bhee de tra na kashtsi dasti dza nodzdzhi ta:sam pri ta ae sha de sha: //
translated: The last chapter of the treatise, “The Law of Good Conduct,” is finished.

original: svetstsh'a pra brittam pra na yo pa na mra:sroo dh'am ga n'a bha gya pa t'am bha banti //
analyzed: svetstsh'a pra brittam pra na yo pa na mra:sroo dh'am ga n'a bha gya pa t'am bha banti //
translated: In this land, which is like a desert, where no one is to be found, and which is filled with wild beasts,🔽the people, who are devoted to the practice of truth, are like the leaves of the forest of the law of righteousness.

original: klishta dha ram kl'anta ka po la pa tram shast'a dag shes pa khyod kyis gang 'di bden par gsal ba nyid du smros //
analyzed: klishta dha ram kl'anta ka po la pa tram shast'a dag shes pa khyod kyis gang 'di bden par gsal ba nyid du smros //

original: yul 'di skye bos spangs shing legs par bsgribs //
analyzed: yul 'di skye bos spangs shing legs par bsgribs //
translated: This land is abandoned by men and well hidden;

original: bden pa 'byed pa su yang med pa 'dir //
analyzed: bden pa 'byed pa su yang med pa 'dir //
translated: here there is no one who would reveal the truth.

original: rang 'dod du 'jug mdza' bas dud pa yi //
analyzed: rang 'dod du 'jug mdza' bas dud pa yi //
translated: The fortunate man, who has entered into her, is like a fire to the fuel of her passion.🔽The fortunate man, who has satisfied her with love,

analyzed: bud med dar ma skal ldan nyid la 'gyur //

translated: tremble with passion,

translated: The special afflictions, the special griefs, the special sorrows, the special efforts of the wise, are for the sake of wealth.

original: chos kyi 'bras bu mchog ni 'dod par brjod //🔽rnam pa mang pos de skad smra byed cing //
analyzed: chos kyi 'bras bu mchog ni 'dod par brjod // rnam pa mang pos de skad smra byed cing //
translated: The purpose of wealth is the purpose of Dharma. The Dharma is said to be the supreme fruit of desire.

original: 'khrugs pa de la gzhon nus rab smras pa //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa de la gzhon nus rab smras pa //
translated: Thus, the youth spoke to him, who was agitated by many words.🔽The youth said to his father: Father, listen to my words.

analyzed: ma ma tshogs gsum gtso bo'i 'bras lam dharmma:pra dh'a n'am ku sh'a la sya n'a bhe: //
translated: the three groups of nurses, the path of the fruit of the principal, the Dharma, the Pradhana, the Kusala, the Nayavati,🔽

analyzed: na nirdza na p'a pa mu pe ti gupta mantarhi ta:svarggi ga no tra s'aksh'i // tstsh'a y'a pra p'a t'a hi sa h'a ya bh'a bam dz'a ye ba dz'a n'a ti dza na sya sarbbam //
translated: The three groups of nurses, the path of the fruit of the principal, the Dharma, the Pradhana, the Kusala, the Nâbhi,🔽The Nirjana, the Papa, the Mupa, the Guhya, the Mantra, the Hita, the Svarga, the Gati, the No, the Traskî.

analyzed: ra ha:kri tam karmma pha lam tya ba syam na karmma n'a masti pha la pra n'a bu ni ; / dge ba'i lte ba rtsa ba dang bcas chos // skye bo med par sdig pa sbas mi 'gyur // 'dir ni dbang po snang min mtho ris tshogs // grogs kyi dngos por gyur pa'i grib mas kyang // chung mas bzhin du skye bo'i thams cad rig / dben par byas pa'i las 'bras nges par smin //
translated: The Châyâ, the Prâpâtâ, the Saha, the Bhâva, the Jaya, the Vaja, the Jânâ, the Ati, the Jana, the Sarva.

original: las rnams 'bras bu rab nyams sha: //
analyzed: las rnams 'bras bu rab nyams sha: //
translated: The Rahas, the Kritam, the Karma, the Phalam, the Tyajam, the Nâmas, the Karma, the Nasti, the Phala, the Prâna, the Bunî.

original: bi sham ni p'i tam bi dza n'andha k'a re pr'a ne shu kim na pra ha ra tya sa dzya //
analyzed: bi sham ni p'i tam bi dza n'andha k'a re pr'a ne shu kim na pra ha ra tya sa dzya //
translated: The son of Visham-nîpa, Tamâla-nanda-kâra, has taken a Sûdra woman for his wife.

original: dz'a ty'a tri ya:p'a pa ni mitta bh'u tasta tr'a pi gho ra:sa ra d'a ra sarga: //
analyzed: dz'a ty'a tri ya:p'a pa ni mitta bh'u tasta tr'a pi gho ra:sa ra d'a ra sarga: //
translated: But the birth of a son to a sinner is a terrible calamity, like a serpent in the house.

original: m'a te ti ma h'atka la he ti yukt'am n'a n+yo pi dzantu: spri sha ti sva k'ant'am //
analyzed: m'a te ti ma h'atka la he ti yukt'am n'a n+yo pi dzantu: spri sha ti sva k'ant'am //
translated: And to him, too, a woman of another caste, called Mâta, has given birth to a son, though he has not touched her.

original: ai tyartha yod ma yin //
analyzed: ai tyartha yod ma yin //
translated: This is not the case.

original: mun nag dben par dug ni 'thungs pa na //
analyzed: mun nag dben par dug ni 'thungs pa na //
translated: Has he not drunk poison in the darkness of night,

original: srog rnams mi bzad 'phrog pa min nam ci //
analyzed: srog rnams mi bzad 'phrog pa min nam ci //
translated: And does he not take away the lives of others?

original: rigs kyi bud med sdig pa'i mtshan mar gyur //
analyzed: rigs kyi bud med sdig pa'i mtshan mar gyur //
translated: The birth of a son to a woman of a different caste is a sign of sin,

original: de la'ang 'jigs rung gzhan gyi bud med 'grogs //
analyzed: de la'ang 'jigs rung gzhan gyi bud med 'grogs //
translated: And he has a terrible connection with another's wife.

original: 'thab mo la rmongs ma zhes mngon sbyar ba'i //
analyzed: 'thab mo la rmongs ma zhes mngon sbyar ba'i //
translated: He is called a fool who is attached to a woman,🔽 And does not touch his own wife, though she has given birth to a son.

original: rang gi chung mar skye gzhan yang mi reg / de ltar don gnyer @56a * //
analyzed: rang gi chung mar skye gzhan yang mi reg / de ltar don gnyer @56a * //
translated: Thus, in order to remove his grief,🔽 The king, with his ministers, went to the place of the sage,🔽 And, being afflicted with heat, he bathed in the lake of Bhangasvari,

original: n'a bham ga pa radmu kh'i s'a ti rakte t'a te na ni t'a ta tapta //
analyzed: n'a bham ga pa radmu kh'i s'a ti rakte t'a te na ni t'a ta tapta //
translated: Which was red with the blood of the demoness.

original: ha r'a mya ba shyam ta ba ne tra darppa muktve ti p'a p'a sva pa d'a ja g'a ma: //🔽t'a ta:pu r'antaksha shi l'a bhi dh'a ma h'i pa te:kunydza ra karnna n'a m'a: //

translated: And, I will take away your eyes, O you who are haughty with your eyes,

analyzed: se n'a ra dza: punydza bi nirdza * // nyams pas phyir phyogs shing // de yi smad pas shin tu gdungs gyur te //

analyzed: khyod kyi mig dregs nges par bdag gis dbrog / ces smras sdig can ma de rang gnas song // de nas grong khyer rdo 'jog ces par ni //
translated: and, I will take away your eyes, O you who are haughty with your eyes,🔽 and, I will take away your eyes, O you who are haughty with your eyes,🔽 and, I will take away your eyes, O you who are haughty with your eyes,
